intro: Selago bilacunosa, commonly known as the silverleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Asia and Australia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, reflective hairs. Its small, white or pale blue flowers bloom in clusters, often during the spring and summer months. Selago bilacunosa is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
